newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-S.AFRICAN MINISTER REPEATS REJECTION OF SPRINGBOKS.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-S.AFRICAN MINISTER REPEATS REJECTION OF SPRINGBOKS.

text.p: South African Finance Minister Trevor Manuel reaffirmed his rejection of the Springboks rugby union side on Wednesday, saying they had failed to bring enough blacks into the sport.

"Too little is happening to convince us that the rugby authorities support change and real development and we will withhold our support until rugby moves," Manuel told the national assembly during a finance debate.

Manuel caused outrage among the ranks of South Africa's mainly white rugby supporters earlier this month when he shouted for New Zealand during a test against South Africa, explaining to fellow spectators: "I am not a white South African."
One newspaper at the time called for Manuel to resign, accusing him of racism.

President Nelson Mandela, who supported the Springbok team during the World Cup last year, was reported to be planning to chide Manuel -- a mixed-race Coloured -- over his preference for the All Blacks.
